meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a gumma.
meanings.sent1: The doctor identified the gummatous growth on the patient's skin.
meanings.sent2: The gummatous lesion was causing discomfort for the individual.
meanings.sent3: The gummatous appearance of the cake made it unappetizing.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds had a gummatous look, signaling an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the gummatous texture of the tree bark in the painting.

meanings.definition: Having the nature of a gumma.
meanings.sent1: The gummatous substance was difficult to remove from the fabric.
meanings.sent2: Her skin showed signs of a gummatous infection.
meanings.sent3: The gummatous consistency of the pudding made it hard to swallow.
meanings.sent4: The old book had a gummatous smell that lingered in the room.
meanings.sent5: The gummatous texture of the rock made it slippery to climb.

meanings.definition: Consisting of or resembling a gumma.
meanings.sent1: The gummatous mass was carefully removed during surgery.
meanings.sent2: The plant had a gummatous appearance due to a fungal infection.
meanings.sent3: The gummatous texture of the bread made it hard to chew.
meanings.sent4: The pond had a gummatous film on its surface after the rain.
meanings.sent5: The gummatous growth on the tree trunk attracted insects.
